We like to go through a routine that we feel
covers everything. Getting the boys into line,

shot stopping, keeping the ball out of the
net.

Working on their technique, we talk about
the perfect save and their shape. This and

that, but first and foremost. Keep the ball
out of the net.

So we start off with a jog and a stretch,
covering the movement we'll be using in a game.

Then we go onto some footwork without a ball.
Because nobody makes saves unless you move your feet.
Your feet are what get you around the goal.
Then we go into some volleys.

This is the time where we practice catching
a ball.

If you can't catch it, can you parry it into

And there'll be a small goal, about three
yards. It's gonna be a pull back, on the shout

If you're calm, you need to make a decision
as quick as possible. Sometimes it does take

a deflection and you just have to react and
get it away. But if you are going to parry

it, get it away as far as possible just to
make that save.

Good hand again, well done.

touch on the post, little step forward and

It's just teaching your goalkeepers that even
